title: The new pop-up message asking to type "I agree" without other options
body:
So today for some reason after loading LoL client my PC starts to slow down.  
First I thought it'll go back to normal after a while.  So the game loaded and I'm in teambuilder where we all waited for more than five minutes for a game to start.  Once it started loading to the battlefield the slowness got worse.  My champion was moving in slow motion!  How is it possible for me to game at all?  So I told the team I have to restart.  After I returned, of course they are losing (particularly playing with lower tiers) and we have no team work either.  All in all, after we lost the game and went back to the score board I had a message popped up.
It is stating that by AFK and leaving the game I have jeopardized the game and telling me not to do it again by typing in "I agree".

Well, if I didn't have the issue I wouldn't have left the game to restart my PC would I??

The point is, there were no other options besides forcing an agreement where you don't have a choice to explain what really happened.

That is not entirely fair is it?  Why isn't there a choice or a comment box besides "I agree"?

replies.body: That is designed to make people aware of the decision they're making when they intentionally leave a game. If this is the only time it's going to happen, then you can safely ignore it.
